alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 8:59AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT SUNDAY NEAR MOOSE CREEK IN GLENNALLEN... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Moose Creek area in Glennallen. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring in low-lying areas along and near Moose Creek due to snowmelt, including local roads off the Glenn Highway in Glennallen. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 852 AM AKDT, The Alaska Department of Transportation reports that water has receded off the Glenn Highway in Glennallen, though pilot car operations continue. Minor flooding continues along other roads in the area. Above average snowpack combined with warming temperatures in mid May will continue to produce minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
